clasifierrr 0.5.0

Calculate variance filter of an image

variance_filter.Rd

Ths filter accentuates areas of high textre

compile_variance_filter(width, dim_img)

variance_filter(img, width, img_fft = fftwtools::fftw2d(img))

Arguments

width

width of the filter to be applied
dim_img

the dimensions of the image to be used later during filtering, only needed if pre-compiling the filter.
img

Dimensions of the image
img_fft

optional argument to pass the pre-computed fourier tranform of the image from `fftwtools::fftw2d(img)`.

Value

Functions

  • compile_variance_filter: pre-calculates parameters and returns a function

See also

Other filters: circular_hough_transform(), compile_hough_circle_draw(), compile_sobel_filter(), dog_filter(), hough_circles_max()

Examples

test_image <- matrix(runif(81), 9)
variance_filter(test_image, 3)
#>             [,1]       [,2]       [,3]       [,4]       [,5]       [,6]
#>  [1,] 0.08202747 0.07334388 0.08691914 0.09455245 0.09033445 0.07608349
#>  [2,] 0.09102443 0.06175628 0.06825599 0.08386713 0.11495879 0.09008251

my_variance_filter <- compile_variance_filter(3, dim(test_image))
my_variance_filter(test_image)
#>             [,1]       [,2]       [,3]       [,4]       [,5]       [,6]
